trans-unit.source: A property used to communicate context between the application and channel layers on either the client or the service.
A collection of properties that are added to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that correlates messages that form part of a conversation between a client and a service.

If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IContextManager.Enabled%2A> is `true`, context is established at the channel layer, and all incoming messages on the client and the service have this context property attached by the context channel.

If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IContextManager.Enabled%2A> is `false` the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty> is used to attach context to an outgoing message on the client or the service at the application layer.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty> can be used on the client or on the service.

Alternatively, on the client only, the current context can be obtained or a new context can be set on channel instance using <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IContextManager.GetContext%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IContextManager.SetContext%2A>properties.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref> class with a specified context.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> that contains the context information used to correlate messages with a specific conversation between a client and a service.
context is `null`.

Sets the value of the `ContextMessageProperty` property in a specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> from the current instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref>.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty.AddOrReplaceInMessage%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%29?displayProperty=fullName> method overwrites the value of the `ContextMessageProperty` property if a value is already set.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> whose context message property is to be set.
message is `null`.

Sets the value of the `ContextMessageProperty` property in a specified collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> from the current instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref>.
The collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> whose context message property is to be set.
is `null`.
Gets the context used to correlate messages within a conversation between a client and a service.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2"></xref> that contains the context information used to correlate messages within a conversation between a client and a service.
Creates a copy of the current instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IMessageProperty"></xref> that contains a sealed copy of the current instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref>.
Gets the name of the context message property.
The string "ContextMessageProperty".
Attempts to instantiate a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextMessageProperty"></xref> from the key/value pairs of a specified HTTP cookie.
The name of the HTTP cookie header from which the context property values are to be initialized.
When this method returns `true`, context contains a that contains the `ContextMessageProperty` that is associated with the httpCookieHeader.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
`true` when a value for the `ContextMessageProperty` is obtained from the httpCookieHeader; otherwise, `false`.
httpCookieHeader is `null`.
Attempts to get the `ContextMessageProperty` from the properties of a specified message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> from which the context message properties are to be retrieved.
When this method returns `true`, contextMessageProperty contains a that contains the `ContextMessageProperty` that is associated with the message.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
`true` when a value for the `ContextMessageProperty` is obtained from the message; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to get the `ContextMessageProperty` from a specified collection of message properties.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageProperties"></xref> from which the context message properties are to be retrieved.
When this method returns `true`, contextMessageProperty contains a that contains the `ContextMessageProperty` that is associated with the properties.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
`true` when a value for the `ContextMessageProperty` is obtained from the properties; otherwise, `false`.
